intro: Clidemia scopulina, commonly known as rock mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Clidemia scopulina is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
